p: The basic study design was RCB (random complete block design) and the replication (pen) was considered as the experimental unit. Experimental data were analyzed by one-way ANOVA (general linear model) function of the SPSS statistical package (version 20.0) ( 39). Microbiology data were log-transformed (log10) before analysis. Data homogeneity was tested using Levene's test. Significance level was set at 5% ( p ≤ 0.05). Values of p between 5 and 10% (0.05 < p ≤ 0.10) were reported as trends.
